documents.document: A portrait of Emilia on @ILFORDPhoto 4x5 large format HP5+ pushed to 1600 on my Speed Graphic, with the Aero Ektar… https://t.co/xQwRRVLqUs
Photography is: _________________
@AlunBeard @ErikSikkema I've found some super awesome shots off found film, develop it! Plus who knows how to properly expose it again. :)
i knew this chic https://t.co/qIsuyngdrQ
Milo Yiannopoulos is the ultimate #snowflake
I'd probably punch him myself if he was in Edmonton... https://t.co/ZiWsZz5d86
Tri-X is my favourite. https://t.co/9zmFvf6QQG
@HelenBoyd123 tiny camera! Perfect for adventure
I can't type tonight
Like that better, and I love the stories it all has. I've worn in my Pentax 67 quite a lot over the years. Some beautiful brassing.
I like buying old cameras in really nice condition, but not to baby them, I wanna be the one that scuffs it, and brasses it, wears it...
@mark_lj I don't shoot digital, nothing against it, I just prefer this way. Never owned a Nikon before though... haha
Seems like it has been used only a handful of times, looks and feels brand new. https://t.co/yV4CYZUETG
Half of my 35mm family https://t.co/D8br6dJan5
@mark_lj I’m actually going to be using theses lenses on the FM2n and the F3HP :)
@mark_lj problem is when you’re hiking in tighter areas and looking up gets much harder. haha.
@mark_lj probably :) not the biggest, but… big. that’s about a 28mm equivalent (it’s 45mm on 645) https://t.co/O8Gjcbd0Nz
@roycastro94 which doesn’t matter to me very much at all, AI or AI-S don’t make much difference to me personally for my shooting
@mark_lj excited to try the 50 1.2, will be very useful
@roycastro94 I think most AI-S lenses have more aperture blades and coatings, but not 100% for which lenses
@mark_lj and yeah, I have a 50mm f/1.2 AI-S coming to me later this week :)
@mark_lj and we go to the mountains a lot, since they’re so close. I think the 35mm will be more suited to people photos, perhaps.
@mark_lj I like 28mm, have one for my AE-1 and my M3 and M6, but I think I need something slightly wider for when I go to the mountains

Definitely need a 50mm, 35mm and a 24mm.
For 24mm I was thinking this lens... https://t.co/thG9ZC970V
Generally speaking anyway. Since starting at f2 you move two whole stops to f4, instead of two stops to 5.6
Plus I think f2 has advantages, not just light collecting and DOF, but stopped down gets higher contrast/quality at lower stops.
I guess there aren't too many options, since I think f2 is required, 2.8 is just often too slow.
Talk to me about Nikon 24mm and 35mm (or even 20mm?) lenses... AI OR AI-S.... nothing newer anyway.
@fujifilmshooter for black and white 4x5 so far I really think it's great - and easy to get great scans
@fujifilmshooter it still needs careful correcting in Photoshop but nothing difficult or more than simple exposure and contrast
@fujifilmshooter there's nothing to it really, for black and white anyways. It scans in auto, then I tweak the histogram quickly
Anyway, really excited to start the next chapter of my photo life with the FM2n and shortly the F3HP will join.
Also. I like the rubber hoods in most cases, and that's a big reason why I got this specific listing.
Got a very nice looking 50mm off eBay, came with front and rear caps as well as the rubber hood. For cheaper with shipping than local...
The first lens I want for the FM2n is a 50mm, the one I wanted (I ordered it off eBay) was more expensive locally though.
And I tell ya, it really is mint...
Even came with a motor drive and a zoom lens. Both I'll sell, so that makes it even cheaper in the long run.
I spent some time looking at local listings for old cameras and ended up saving around $150 on a mint Nikon FM2n. Lucky!
@mrsaislinL might recognize the location… :) thank you, lots more soon.

I’m becoming less defined as the days go by…
A portrait of Emilia on Pentax 67 and #KodakFilm Tri-X, my favourite… https://t.co/jVEmHWPdSj
I'm becoming less defined as the days go by... sometimes I think I can see right through myself.… https://t.co/sGSB8Xm7WU
.@ArneKuilman yeah mine haha this one too... WP1 is great! https://t.co/CUCLxiZbsh

Underwater film :)
Expired Portra 400NC on the Canon WP-1. Off the coast of Cancun, Mexico. #KodakFilm https://t.co/Up5xw2zzYc
@pjdejesus @rpimi If there is a real reason to need longer, like most sports - then yeah it makes sense. Usually a necessity thing
@rpimi yeah, why not just be honest about it, I like gettting closer. They know, but you get them settled and it's far more intimate shots
@rpimi yeah I agree, I don't like how it feels when it's a longer lens, feels like spying or stealing a moment, not being in one
There are exceptions and it really is personal taste, but when I see portraits with longer lenses I feel like I'm absent from a conversation
The problem for me is that lenses longer than 50mm for portraits often feel like you're too far away, not right up beside them for a chat
@fujifilmshooter nope. Just the free software with the epson. No point (in my opinion), especially for black and white
@roycastro94 pakon I think I'd like 12x18 or slightly less for prints that will look alright/good. But I don't remember :) been a while
@roycastro94 yup. V700 can scan quite large. I haven't tried it yet, soon, but I'm sure you would print much larger from v700
@roycastro94 v700 is great for black and white or larger film in general. I scan all my 4x5 on there. Pakon is pretty nice
Hands on, from planning, to shooting, to developing, to scanning. I enjoy it all. A photo shoot isn't just an after… https://t.co/5R9PCslzbx
@tmway84 not a bad way to spend some time :)
Scan party part 2 https://t.co/O7Tq7H7B8j
Film scanning party in my bedroom (literally) https://t.co/nJLpfJ91Iy
My friends... how perfect. https://t.co/gmJinGfXEN

Shooters are white. Terrorists are brown.

@DaveMackay17 very cool. Easy to use after a few rounds, even this older one
This is what politicians and people putting up walls and denying others leads to... an environment of us vs. then. https://t.co/W3jzzVyyET
@weston_mcghee excellent. It works well. I've never had a problem before
@roycastro94 AE-1 is good. But I know a more top end SLR is what I really want. Will get a F3HP soon as well.
@weston_mcghee the MOD54? This is the oldest version, new ones have many upgrades- but still hold 6 :) mine works great
6 sheets of 4x5 film fit in here for developing https://t.co/RC5oNHgTaV

Today I bought a fresh Nikon 50mm for my FM2. Pretty excited.
@ArneKuilman it's great hahah one of my favorite pizzas
I have hope. Maybe Donald Trump is what we needed, someone so stupid, so vile and cowardly that we learn and never… https://t.co/A1Ybd6nV37

@ozalba but I'll always come back :)
@ozalba that's the smartest path yet

@RobZeigler I own one of these - the thick neck-pad is really nice https://t.co/LMRz8gd6A3
@RobZeigler bumpers aren't always needed, but I like them. And the neckpad makes it much nicer to use for long periods
@ArneKuilman @mpouliot_photo oh yes, I have one too, beer nice little cameras
@mpouliot_photo yeah that makes sense, I was worried but it's totally fine for me
@brupsilva the prices seem good, lots around - I really need to try one
Still going to get the F3HP though. I can really see these as my ultimate travel and adventure cameras, as well as daily life. Important!
I had read a lot about eye glasses and the FM2N or the F3HP. It sounded grim. But I seem to do just fine on the FM2. Maybe thin glasses?
That FM2N is really good in the hands, can't wait for the 50mm to show up in the mail sometime in the next week or so. Hmmmm
@ozalba @MikeIsaac one can only hope
@jonduenas Makes sense, wish it was linear still...
@jonduenas whatever those times are.... I usually just post when I'm home again in the early evening
@jonduenas hmmmm makes sense. So I'm assuming most people who pay attention are posting same as before then
@roycastro94 probably shoot a lot of colour - but the black and white is beautiful too. Also the yellow film (or red) looks cool
@roycastro94 I'm going to order a variety and see what I like. I haven't shot it in over a year - so I need to freshen up
@roycastro94 focused fine even in my dark room with a lamp on. Hand, table, wall, whatever it just focused so quick haha
@roycastro94 not yet :)
The focus system is crazy good! Even in the dark (it uses sound to focus).
Oh yeah! Forgot I ordered one of these.... :) arrived today. https://t.co/aP2OIBQewR
Sometimes you have to throw a few bricks.
@PonsMaite it’s pretty insane, I don’t quite understand how this has happened, but… wow.
We knew Trump and his team were .... stupid. But holy shit today's ongoing news is just baffling hahahah... what to cover first?! Damn.
I'm thinking I need two of these for the analog Nikons... hmmmmm beauty https://t.co/86Y4WvFDsq
@WilliamHumphr11 I didn't know I was going this way with the SLRs until about a week ago haha
@martaverymarta yeah mine feels very different, I guess it doesn't really matter. Frustrating though
